exercises.title: Sorting Materials into Groups Exercises
exercises.content: 1. Name five objects which can be made from wood.

exercises.title: Sorting Materials into Groups Exercises
exercises.content: 2. Select those objects from the following which shine: Glass bowl, plastic toy, steel spoon, cotton shirt

exercises.title: Sorting Materials into Groups Exercises
exercises.content:
3. Match the objects given below with the materials from which they could be made. Remember, an object could be made from more than one material and a given material could be used for making many objects.
Objects: Book, Tumbler, Chair, Toy, Shoes
Materials: Glass, Wood, Paper, Leather, Plastics

exercises.title: Sorting Materials into Groups Exercises
exercises.content:
4. State whether the statements given below are True or False.
(i) Stone is transparent, while glass is opaque.
(ii) A notebook has lustre while eraser does not.
(iii) Chalk dissolves in water.
(iv) A piece of wood floats on water.
(v) Sugar does not dissolve in water.
(vi) Oil mixes with water.
(vii) Sand settles down in water.
(viii) Vinegar dissolves in water.

exercises.title: Sorting Materials into Groups Exercises
exercises.content:
5. Given below are the names of some objects and materials: Water, basket ball, orange, sugar, globe, apple and earthen pitcher
Group them as:
(a) Round shaped and other shapes
(b) Eatables and non eatables

exercises.title: Sorting Materials into Groups Exercises
exercises.content: 6. List all items known to you that float on water. Check and see if they will float on an oil or kerosene.

exercises.title: Sorting Materials into Groups Exercises
exercises.content:
7. Find the odd one out from the following:
(a) Chair, Bed, Table, Baby, Cupboard
(b) Rose, Jasmine, Boat, Marigold, Lotus
(c) Aluminium, Iron, Copper, Silver, Sand
(d) Sugar, Salt, Sand, Copper sulphate
